claims: The world's oldest living tree is named Methuselah

state.response: دنیا کے سب سے قدیم زندہ درخت کا نام میتھوسیلا ہے
claims: The world's oldest living tree is named Methuselah

The world's oldest living tree is named: What is the world's oldest living tree? Methuselah tree age

Methuselah. With a death-defying 4,842 years under its belt, this Great Basin bristlecone pine deserves its name. This is considered to be the oldest non-clonal organism (i.e., individual plant) on the planet.
What is the world's oldest living tree? Methuselah tree age

In eastern California, a Great Basin bristlecone pine (Pinus longaeva) known as Methuselah has long been considered Earth's oldest living thing. According to tree-ring data, Methuselah is 4,853 years old — meaning it was well established by the time ancient Egyptians built the pyramids at Giza.
